unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Karnataka**
normalised: Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Karnataka

unnormalised: BANGALORE, Karnataka – The state government's ambitious smart meter project is progressing steadily, with initial installations showing promising results in reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses. Energy Minister, Shri. Rajeshwari Devi, announced on 20/07/2024 that over 50,000 smart meters have been deployed in Bangalore and Mysore as part of Phase 1.
normalised: BANGALORE, Karnataka – The state government's ambitious smart meter project is progressing steadily, with initial installations showing promising results in reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses. Energy Minister, Shri. Rajeshwari Devi, announced on twentieth july two thousand and twenty four that over fifty thousand smart meters have been deployed in Bangalore and Mysore as part of Phase one.

unnormalised: The project, aimed at modernizing the power distribution infrastructure, utilizes real-time data analytics to detect and prevent energy theft. BESCOM (Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited) officials confirmed a noticeable decrease in power outages since the implementation began at 14:00 hrs on 10/05/2024. Consumers are also benefiting from improved transparency in billing and access to usage data via a dedicated mobile app.

unnormalised: A pilot project in Dharwad district, commencing on 01/01/2024, involved providing subsidized smart meters to rural households, reducing average monthly bills by Rs. 200. The full rollout, projected to cover 2 crore households across the state, is expected to be completed by 2027. This initiative aligns with the central government's Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme, aiming to enhance grid stability and reliability nationwide.
